item.title: 12 Important - Folder Visibility in Quartz (index.md Rule)
item.description: üö® Key Learning Quartz does NOT treat folders like Windows Explorer.

item.title: index
item.description: GIT Setup for Obsidian All notes related to Git setup and Quartz publishing.

item.title: 01 How to setup GIT in Desktop.
item.description: üß≠ Overall Idea (simple understanding) Your vault will live in 3 places: Laptop 1 ‚Üê‚Üí GitHub Repo ‚Üê‚Üí Laptop 2 ‚Üê‚Üí Android (later) You will: Push = send notes to GitHub Pull = download latest notes ü™ú STEP 1 ‚Äî Create a GitHub repository Go to: github.com Create account (if not already) Click: New Repos...

item.title: 02 How to upload your existing vault to Github
item.description: üìç STEP 1 ‚Äî Open terminal inside your vault folder Go to your Obsidian vault location.

item.title: 03 Setup on SECOND laptop
item.description: In second laptop: Install Git Install Obsidian Open terminal in the folder where you want vault Run: git clone github.com/(github_username)/Obsidian_Vault.git Then open that folder in Obsidian.

item.title: 04 ERROR - ‚ÄúGit is not ready. When all settings are correct you can configure commit-sync‚Äù
item.description: Initial steps: Open GIT folder and then double click on the bin folder.

item.title: 05 How to setup in Mobile Device
item.description: Step 1 ‚Äî Install apps From Play Store install: Obsidian Termux (optional but helpful) Step 2 ‚Äî Download your vault from GitHub We need the vault folder on phone.

item.title: 06 Commit and Sync + Pull Workflow
item.description: You DON‚ÄôT have to manually press anything most of the time if you have enabled auto commit and sync.

item.title: 07 Fixing Obsidian Git Sync Errors (Merge Conflicts, Pull, Push Issues & Multi-Device Setup Guide)
item.description: If you use Obsidian with Git across multiple devices (home laptop, office laptop, mobile), you will eventually run into confusing errors like: ‚ÄúConflicts detected‚Äù ‚ÄúYour local changes would be overwritten‚Äù ‚ÄúUpdates were rejected (fetch first)‚Äù Files showing <<<<<<< HEAD and >...

item.title: 08 Quartz Startup Guide = From Obsidian Notes to a Fully Published Website (Step-by-Step + Real Mistakes & Fixes)
item.description: This is a complete beginner-to-advanced setup guide for turning your Obsidian notes into a public website using Quartz + GitHub Pages.
